intro: Phyllanthus seydelii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has smooth, green leaves with a slightly waxy texture and produces small, round, green fruits. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Phyllanthus seydelii is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
